intro: Melicope quadrilocularis, commonly known as the Hawaiian melicope, is a member of the Rutaceae family and is native to the Hawaiian Islands. It is a small to medium-sized evergreen tree that typically grows in moist, shaded habitats within tropical rainforests. The plant has simple, opposite, elliptical leaves with a rough, textured surface. Its flowers are small, fragrant, and yellowish-green, while its fruit is a woody, four-lobed capsule. Melicope quadrilocularis plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, providing food and shelter for various native wildlife species.
